intro: Ximenia subscandens, commonly known as the African wild almond, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing hard, angular seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. The plant has traditional uses in medicine and as a source of edible seeds.
